about.title: Professional legal service with a personal approach
about.p1: The office provides legal and notarial services with emphasis on precision, accessibility and clear communication at every step.
about.p2: Matters are handled with practical planning, accurate documentation, and close follow-up until completion.
about.p3:
Moria Rodrig, Advocate and Notary, is an experienced legal professional with extensive practice in real estate and civil-commercial law. Over the years, she has developed strong practical expertise in handling complex property transactions, while providing precise legal solutions tailored to each client’s needs.

Her office provides comprehensive legal support for real estate transactions from preliminary due diligence, through negotiation and contract drafting, and up to final registration with the Land Registry.

Moria has unique expertise in representing foreign residents and regularly advises clients from Israel and abroad in real estate matters, notarial documentation, and cross-border legal procedures, with multilingual service delivered efficiently and accurately, including remote handling where required.

In addition, her office handles wills, enduring powers of attorney, commercial agreements, and full notarial services in accordance with applicable regulations, with consistent emphasis on professionalism, availability, and personal guidance throughout the process.

Beyond her legal practice, Moria is active in public service and serves as Chair of the Association of Belgian Immigrants in Israel, and as a municipal representative in the Reservists’ Wives Forum, reflecting a deep commitment to community and social resilience.

Moria believes in combining legal precision, strategic thinking, and personal service, and accompanies her clients with confidence and transparency until the optimal result is achieved.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: This Privacy Policy governs personal data processing carried out through the website of Moria Rodrig - Law Office and Notary and its integrated online appointment booking system.

scope.title: 1. Scope of processing
scope.body: This Policy applies only to data collected and processed via this website, including booking requests, technical usage analytics, and related communications.

data.title: 2. Personal data collected
data.body: When a booking is submitted, the system processes:

items.name: Full name
items.slot: Requested date, time slot and meeting duration

items.analytics: Monitor and improve website usability and performance.

systems.title: 4. Systems and processors in active use

items.calendar: Google Calendar API: used to check calendar availability and create confirmed appointment events.
items.database: PostgreSQL database: used to store appointment records submitted through the booking flow.
items.clarity: Microsoft Clarity: used to collect website analytics and interaction insights for service and interface improvement.

cookies.title: 5. Cookies and analytics notice (Clarity)
cookies.body1: This website uses Microsoft Clarity and similar analytics technologies, including cookies and tracking scripts, to understand user behavior, troubleshoot usability issues and improve website performance.
cookies.body2: By continuing to use this website, you acknowledge such analytics processing. Browser settings may be used to restrict cookies, noting that certain functions may be affected.

legalBasis.title: 6. Legal basis
legalBasis.body: Data processing is carried out on applicable legal grounds, including steps requested by the data subject prior to service engagement, legitimate interests in secure website operation, and legal or professional compliance duties.

disclosure.title: 7. Disclosure and third-party transfer
disclosure.body: Personal data is not sold. Data is disclosed only to the operational providers listed above, or where disclosure is required by law, judicial order or competent authority.

retention.title: 8. Retention
retention.body: Appointment-related records are retained for a period reasonably required for service administration, legal obligations and professional record management.

security.title: 9. Security
security.body: Reasonable technical and organizational safeguards are implemented to reduce risks of unauthorized access, alteration, loss or misuse of data. Absolute security in online systems cannot be guaranteed.

rights.title: 10. Data subject rights
rights.body: Subject to applicable law, users may request access, correction or deletion of personal data processed through this website.

revisions.title: 12. Policy revisions
revisions.body: This Policy may be updated from time to time to reflect legal, technological or operational changes. The current published version on this page is the governing version.
